solution_line_template: The kitchen and two bathroom modules will take up {kitchen_sq_ft}+{bathroom_sq_ft}+{bathroom_sq_ft}=<<{kitchen_sq_ft}+{bathroom_sq_ft}+{bathroom_sq_ft}={modules_sq_ft}>>{modules_sq_ft} sq. ft. of the {total_home_sq_ft} sq. ft. of space.
Thus, the remaining modular space is {total_home_sq_ft}-{modules_sq_ft}=<<{total_home_sq_ft}-{modules_sq_ft}={remaining_sq_ft}>>{remaining_sq_ft} sq. ft.
Cost of the kitchens and bathrooms is ${kitchen_cost}+${bathroom_cost}+${bathroom_cost}=$<<{kitchen_cost}+{bathroom_cost}+{bathroom_cost}={modules_cost}>>{modules_cost}.

The cost of the other {remaining_sq_ft} sq. ft. of space is {remaining_sq_ft}*${other_module_cost_per_sq_ft}=$<<{remaining_sq_ft}*{other_module_cost_per_sq_ft}={other_modules_cost}>>{other_modules_cost}.

In total, the cost of the complete 2000 sq.ft. modular home with one kitchen and two bathrooms is ${modules_cost} + ${other_modules_cost} = ${<<{modules_cost}+{other_modules_cost}={total_cost}>>}{total_cost}.
